site_name: COLNE VALLEY VIADUCT, WETLANDS ECOLOGICAL MITIGATION SITE
decision_conditions: The impact on the local environment, amenity, road safety, traffic, archaeology, historic interest and nature conservation has been considered within the main body of the report. It is concluded that the design and external appearance of the works are acceptable. It is not considered that the design and external appearance of the works ought to be modified and it is recommended that the application be approved, in accordance with Schedule 17, Part 1, Paragraph 3, of the High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Act 2017.
application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Request for approval of plans and specifications secured under condition imposed by Schedule 17 to the High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Act 2017 relating to the design and external appearance of the Colne Valley Viaduct (part of Scheduled Work 2/1) noise barrier (commencing at a point 60 metres to the southeast of the existing Harvil Road alignment and 255 metres north of the Harvil Road crossing of the Chilterns Line; terminating at a point 120 metres west of the A412 - North Orbital Road and 180 metres west-northwest of Weybeards Cottages).
